name: 李老师不是你老师
content: May 3 is World Press Freedom Day. On that day, the topic "World Press Freedom Day" on Weibo was banned.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: May 3, British Embassy in China: “What would it be like if there was a Chinese newspaper that presented readers with a different perspective on media freedom and human rights issues?”

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: May 1st, Hunan Huaihua Fantasy Dimension Animation and Game Carnival

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: May 2, Shandong. Huanghai Shipyard owes workers wages, workers sit in protest outside the company to demand their wages

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Recently, in Xingtai, Hebei, the Sanfeng Wanhecheng real estate project had been unfinished for fifteen years. The helpless owners decided to simply repair the house and move in, and set up a big pot downstairs to cook a big pot of rice.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On May 2, during the CBA Guangdong vs Liaoning match, Guangdong team member Xu Jie wrote "48 R.I.P" on his sneakers to express his condolences to the victims of the Guangdong Meida Expressway landslide disaster.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: https://t.co/DQvlfUO8v0

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
May 4 (Released) Shandong Linyi.
It is reported online that in the Lanshan District Owners Committee group, the head of the Owners Committee Liu Huiying mocked the owners who expressed different opinions, jokingly saying that they were "trying to stop a chariot with a mantis arm" and "overestimating their own abilities."

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: https://t.co/DEycXVSNKH

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On May 3, blogger Diguaxiong Laoliu said that a tourist had submitted an article to him, saying that in a Chinese supermarket in Japan, the packaging of Xiangpiaopiao Meco had words printed in Chinese and Japanese, such as "We can live without Japan, but we can't live without the ocean" and "Japanese politicians, please drink the nuclear wastewater."

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On May 2, the Wall Street Journal revealed that due to dissatisfaction with the Chinese system and economic slowdown, some wealthy Chinese chose to buy properties in Japan, boosting the Tokyo luxury housing market. The report said that as of the end of last year, there were about 822,000 Chinese residents in Japan, an increase of 60,000 from the previous year, the largest increase in recent years. …

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: May 4, Qingyang City, Gansu Province.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: China Post's New Portrait Law

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: https://t.co/9HCx3suKwM

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
On May 4, after the ninth round of the Dalian vs. Guangzhou match in China League One, fans clashed with police, and some fans were beaten. 
Fans at the scene angrily scolded the police for being "shameful" and demanded an apology.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Figure 1 What fans said at the scene
Figure 2 According to news reports, Dalian Yingbo lost 0-1 to Guangzhou in the match. After the match, a conflict broke out between the players of the two teams, and Dalian's foreign aid was photographed chasing and beating Guangzhou goalkeeper Huo Shenping.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Dalian home fans threw water bottles at the bus carrying Guangzhou team players after the game.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: At the scene, fans continued to confront the police and demanded an apology.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Fans and police clashed violently

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Later, the police withdrew

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: The police retreated, and some fans stopped the police car and demanded an apology.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: The remaining fans played football near the police

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: https://t.co/kybdo6uG65

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Fans at the scene recounted the incident
